[In Common Schema]Suggested delimiters include the semicolon ';' and comma ',' characters.
[In Common Schema]Categories can be absent from items and can be absent from the schema.
[In Common Schema]ContentTypeId: This property identifies the item type of each item.
[In Common Schema]The format of ContentTypeId is defined in [MS-LISTSWS].
[In Common Schema]ContentTypeId begins with 0x0102 corresponds to Appointment Content / item type name.
[In Common Schema]ContentTypeId begins with 0x0106 corresponds to Contact Content / item type name.
[In Common Schema]ContentTypeId begins with 0x012002 corresponds to Discussion item Content / item type name.
[In Common Schema]ContentTypeId begins with 0x0101 corresponds to Document Content / item type name.
[In Common Schema]ContentTypeId begins with 0x0120 corresponds to Folder Content / item type name.
[In Common Schema]ContentTypeId Begins With 0x0108 corresponds to Task Content / item type name.
[In Common Schema]ContentTypeId Begins With 0x010801 corresponds to Workflow Task (a subtype of Task) Content / item type name.
[In Common Schema]Protocol clients MAY choose to ignore ContentTypeId and assume all items in a list are a particular type.<23>
[In Common Schema]Created: The date and time the item was created.
[In Common Schema]Created can be absent from items and can be absent from the schema.
[In Common Schema]ID: An integer that uniquely identifies this item from all other items in the list.
[In Common Schema]Protocol clients are not allowed to change the identifier.
[In Common Schema]IDs are assigned by the protocol server, so protocol clients also cannot set an identifier on a new item.
[In Common Schema]Modified: Date and time that the item was last modified.
[In Common Schema]For document items, protocol clients MUST NOT assume that this time is the same as the last modified time of the document file.
[In Common Schema]Modified can be absent from items and can be absent from the schema.
[In Common Schema]owshiddenversion: This is an integer that increases by 1 every time the item is modified on the protocol server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R454

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Common Schema]owshiddenversion: This is an integer that increases by 1 for a sample of N(default N=2) times the item is modified on the protocol server.
[In Common Schema]ReplicationID: This property is of the simple type stringGUID.
[In Common Schema]Protocol clients SHOULD generate a GUID when creating new items on the protocol server and fill the ReplicationID property with it.
[In Common Schema]This[MS-OUTSPS] allows a protocol client to correctly identify the item later if the creation succeeds but the protocol client receives no response from the protocol server.
[In Common Schema]Protocol servers can choose to set ReplicationID on new items created by the protocol server.
[In Common Schema]ReplicationID can be absent from items and the ReplicationID field can be absent from the schema.
[In Common Schema]vti_versionhistory: Version history is a list of GUIDs and integers in the following format: GUID:Integer,GUID:Integer,GUID:Integer
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]There can be any nonzero number of GUID-integer pairs in the list.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]Each unique GUID MUST appear at most once in the list.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]The list is not sorted, so any GUID can be the one paired with the highest integer.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]One integer MUST be greater than all other integers.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]Protocol clients MAY remove the pairs with the smallest integers to save space.<24>
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]Protocol servers MAY remove the pairs with the smallest integers to save space.<24>
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]GUIDs are written as a hexadecimal string with no non-hexadecimal characters.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]The vti_versionhistory field can be absent from the schema.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]Version history is built in the following way: Every protocol client and protocol server that edits items generates a GUID.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]This GUID[generated by every client and server that edits items] is reused and not regenerated.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]Each time an item is updated, the highest integer is found among the GUID-integer pairs.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]This[integer] is the version number.
[In Common Schema][Version history is built in the following way: 2.]That integer is incremented by one to get the integer to use in step '3'.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]The editing protocol client or protocol server searches for its GUID in the GUID-integer pairs and removes the pair if it is found.
[In Common Schema][Version history is built in the following way: 3.]Then the editing protocol client or protocol server inserts a new GUID-integer pair using its GUID and the integer from step '2'.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]Protocol clients and protocol servers can use the version history to perform conflict detection and resolution,

[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]In these conflict cases, if the GUID-integer pair with the lower integer is found in the version history with the higher integer, then the lower integer item is a previous state of the higher integer item.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]Protocol clients SHOULD use this to do more sophisticated conflict resolution than a simple equality comparison.
[In Common Schema][vti_versionhistory:]Protocol clients SHOULD choose to overwrite the older version instead of reporting a conflict.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]The appointment schema implements the appointments (section 3.1.1) abstract data model.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]All appointment properties can be empty or missing unless this section states otherwise.<25>

[In Appointment-Specific Schema][One of the appointment properties appears as the attributes of the element GetListResponse.GetListResult.List.Fields.Field. Field.Name:]EndDate[ Field.ID:]{2684f9f2-54be-429f-ba06-76754fc056bf}[Field.Type:]DateTime.

[In Appointment-Specific Schema][One of the appointment properties appears as the attributes of the element GetListResponse.GetListResult.List.Fields.Field. Field.Name:]EventDate[ Field.ID:]{64cd368d-2f95-4bfc-a1f9-8d4324ecb007}[Field.Type:]DateTime.

[In Appointment-Specific Schema][One of the appointment properties appears as the attributes of the element GetListResponse.GetListResult.List.Fields.Field. Field.Name:]FooterInfo[ Field.ID:]None defined[Field.Type:]None defined (Text).

[In Appointment-Specific Schema][One of the appointment properties appears as the attributes of the element GetListResponse.GetListResult.List.Fields.Field. Field.Name:]Location[ Field.ID:]{288f5f32-8462-4175-8f09-dd7ba29359a9}[Field.Type:]Text.

[In Appointment-Specific Schema][One of the appointment properties appears as the attributes of the element GetListResponse.GetListResult.List.Fields.Field. Field.Name:]UID[ Field.ID:]{63055d04-01b5-48f3-9e1e-e564e7c6b23b}[Field.Type:]GUID.

[In Appointment-Specific Schema][One of the appointment properties appears as the attributes of the element GetListResponse.GetListResult.List.Fields.Field. Field.Name:]XMLTZone[ Field.ID:]{c4b72ed6-45aa-4422-bff1-2b6750d30819}[Field.Type:]Note.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]BusyStatus: A BusyStatus (section 2.2.5.1) type.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]This busy status specifies what busy status the last Editor of the event wanted.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Description: Any user entered text about the appointment.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Duration: The duration of the appointment, in seconds.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Duration can be empty or missing.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Duration can be calculated from the EventDate and EndDate.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If the fAllDayEvent property is 1, the Duration MUST be 86340 seconds (1 minute less than 24 hours) when the appointment is not a single appointment.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If the fAllDayEvent property is 1, the Duration MUST be [(days of EndDate days of EventDate + 1)*86400-60] seconds when the appointment is a single appointment.

[In Appointment-Specific Schema]The fAllDayEvent property is 0, then: 1. Change both the EventDate and EndDate into a time zone with no DST transitions, such as UTC. 2. Remove the date portion of the results from step 2.1 so only the time portion remains. If the appointment is a single appointment, skip this step. 3. Subtract the EventDate value from step 2.2 from the EndDate value from step 2.2. The result is the duration.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Editor: The name of the last person who made changes to the item.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]EndDate: The ending date and time of the appointment.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]EndDate MUST be equal to or later than EventDate.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]EndDate can be empty or missing.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If EndDate is not provided, then protocol clients SHOULD follow the guidelines in section 3.2.1.1.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]EventDate: The starting date and time of the appointment.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]EventDate MUST be equal to or earlier than EndDate.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]EventDate MUST NOT be empty or missing.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If the fAllDayEvent property is 1 then the time portion of the EventDate MUST be 0 hours UTC as in this example: "2009-05-19T00:00:00Z".
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]EventType: An EventType (section 2.2.5.5) integer.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]EventType MUST NOT be empty or missing.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If the EventType is one that the protocol client does not support, then the protocol client SHOULD treat it as a single instance event.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If the EventType indicates a recurring event, then fRecurrence MUST be 1.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Otherwise[if the EventType does not indicate a recurring event] fRecurrence MUST be 0.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If EventType indicates a recurring event and fRecurrence is FALSE, then the item is not a recurring event.

[In Appointment-Specific Schema]fAllDayEvent: A booleanInteger value that specifies whether the appointment is an all-day appointment, as specified in the appointments (section 3.2.1.1) abstract data model.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If fAllDayEvent is empty or missing, then the default value is 0, which means false.<26>
[In Appointment-Specific Schema][For fAllDayEvent, the value ]1 means TRUE.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]FollowUp: A FollowUp (section 2.2.5.6) integer.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]FooterInfo: Any user entered text that is meant to appear after the Description text.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]fRecurrence: A booleanInteger value that specifies whether the EventType value indicates a recurring event or an exception.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema][For fRecurrence]1 means it[event] is a recurring event or an exception,
[In Appointment-Specific Schema][For fRecurrence]0 means it[event] is not[ recurring].
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]fRecurrence MUST NOT be empty or missing.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]HeaderInfo: Any user-entered text that is meant to appear before the Description text.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]IntendedBusyStatus: A BusyStatus (section 2.2.5.1) type.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]This property[IntendedBusyStatus] specifies the busy status the creator of the event wanted.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Location: Any text specifying where the event is supposed to take place.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]MasterSeriesItemID: This exists only for exception items.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]This[IntendedBusyStatus] is the item identifier
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Participants: A Participants (section 2.2.5.9) string.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Priority: A Priority (section 2.2.5.10) integer .
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]RecurrenceData: If EventType is 1, this property MUST contain a valid RecurrenceXML (section 2.2.4.4).
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If fRecurrence is FALSE, then this property[RecurrenceData] MUST be ignored [and can be empty or missing].
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If fRecurrence is FALSE, then this property[RecurrenceData] [MUST be ignored and ]can be empty or missing.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]RecurrenceID: RecurrenceID MUST be equal to the starting date and time of one instance of a recurrence when the EventType indicates an exception or deleted instance.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If the EventType is something else[0], then RecurrenceID can be empty or missing.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]TimeZone: If fRecurrence is TRUE, this property SHOULD contain an integer index into a list of time zones.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R442.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appointment-Specific Schema]Where this list exists and how to access it is an implementation detail of the protocol server.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Protocol servers SHOULD set a number in this[TimeZone] value, but can leave it[TimeZone] empty.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R1270.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appointment-Specific Schema]Protocol clients SHOULD remember whatever number the protocol server provides here.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Protocol clients SHOULD set the recurrence TimeZone integer on exceptions to a recurrence (section 3.2.1.1.3) when protocol clients update exception items.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Protocol clients SHOULD NOT use TimeZone for any other purpose.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Instead, protocol clients SHOULD use XMLTZone because this approach is more extensible and flexible.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If fRecurrence is FALSE, then protocol clients SHOULD ignore TimeZone.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]Title: Any text describing the event.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]This text is typically shorter than Description, but might be longer.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If the EventType is something else[1], then RecurrenceID can be empty or missing.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]UID: If fRecurrence is true, this property[UID] MUST contain a valid stringGUID (section 2.2.5.11).
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]UID is one of the fields used to indicate recurrence changes (section 3.2.4.2.3)
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]UID MUST be changed if, and only if, the recurrence has been changed or added.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]UID SHOULD be unique among all other recurring events on this list.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R31201.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appointment-Specific Schema]The queryOptions.RecurrenceOrderBy (section 3.1.4.7) sort order relies on a unique UID to provide unambiguous results.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If fRecurrence is false, then this property[UID] MUST be ignored.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R31301

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appointment-Specific Schema]If fRecurrence is false, whether the UID is valid or invalid, the server reply the same.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]The TimeZoneXML defines the time zone the event uses.
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If fRecurrence is FALSE, then this property[TimeZoneXML] SHOULD be ignored [and can be empty].
[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If fRecurrence is FALSE, then this property[TimeZoneXML] [SHOULD be ignored and] can be empty.

[In Appointment-Specific Schema]If EventType is 1 and fAllDayEvent is 1, XMLTZone MUST indicate a time zone with no bias or offset: "<timeZoneRule><standardBias>0</standardBias><additionalDaylightBias>0</additionalDaylightBias></timeZoneRule>".
[In Updating Recurring Appointments]Protocol clients need to be careful when updating a recurring item.

[In Updating Recurring Appointments]Updating properties that describe the recurrence of an item MAY result in the deletion of exception items (section 3.2.1.1.3) and deleted instance items (section 3.2.1.1.4).

[In Updating Recurring Appointments]These properties[affected when updating a recurring item] are specified in section 3.2.4.2.2 and include those in the following list: EndDate,EventDate,RecurrenceData,UID,XMLTZone

[In Updating Recurring Appointments]Protocol clients MUST include the deleteExceptions element of RecurrenceXML (section 2.2.4.4) when changing one or more of those properties to cause the protocol server trigger exception deletion.
[In Updating Recurring Appointments]Protocol servers SHOULD trigger exception deletion when XMLZone is updated.<27>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R44502.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Updating Recurring Appointments]Protocol clients SHOULD NOT send any updates to these properties unless the recurrence has changed.[<27>]

[In Contact-Specific Schema]Account: Any kind of text string that is about an account.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Anniversary: The date of the contact's wedding or anniversary.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]AssistantNumber: Assistants phone number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]AssistantsName: Assistants name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]AttachProps: Information about an attachment that is specified as the AttachProps (section 2.2.4.1) complex type.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]BCPicture: This helps a protocol client to display information about a contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema][For information of BCPicture]See PidLidBusinessCardCardPicture in [MS-OXOCNTC], section 2.2.1.7.2.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Clients can pass this through as text instead of processing it[BCPicture].
[In Contact-Specific Schema]BillingInformation: A string in any kind of format that describes billing information.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Birthday: Date of birth.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]BizCard: This helps a protocol client to display information about a contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema][For information of BizCard]See PidLidBusinessCardDisplayDefinition in [MS-OXOCNTC], section 2.2.1.7.1.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Clients can pass this through as text instead of processing it[BizCard].
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Business2Number: Second work phone number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CallbackNumber: Phone number used to return calls.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CarNumber: Car phone number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CellPhone: Cellular phone number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Certificate: This helps a protocol client to send secure e-mail.
[In Contact-Specific Schema][For information of Certificate]See PidTagUserX509Certificate in [MS-OXOCNTC], section 2.2.1.10.24.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Clients can pass this through as text instead of processing it[Certificate].
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CertificateStr: The name of, or a string describing, the contents of either Certificate or CertificatesX509.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CertificatesX509: This helps a protocol client to send secure e-mail.
[In Contact-Specific Schema][For information of CertificatesX509]See PidTagUserX509Certificate in [MS-OXOCNTC], section 2.2.1.10.23.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Clients can pass this through as text instead of processing it[CertificatesX509].
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ChildrensNames: A delimited string containing the contact's children's names.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Comments: Any text the user wants to enter about the item.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Company: Company or business name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CompanyNumber: Company or business phone number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CompanyPhonetic: yomigana for the company name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ComputerNetworkName: Computer network name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ConfDefServerIndex: The index of the default protocol server to use from the list contained in the ConfServerNames property.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]The first entry is index 0.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]-1 or an item without this property indicates no default protocol server has been set.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ConfServerNames: Delimited string of server names.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]These server names are usually for servers that handle meetings between groups of people over a network.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ContactLinkName: Delimited string of names of contacts that are relevant to this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CustomerID: Any string that identifies the contact as a customer.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Editor: The last person to change this item.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Email: Primary e-mail address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Email2: Second e-mail address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Email3: Third e-mail address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]EmailDisplayAs1: The string that the user interface SHOULD display instead of the e-mail address in the Email field when users send mail to this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]EmailDisplayAs2: The string that the user interface SHOULD display instead of the e-mail address in the Email2 field when users send mail to this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]EmailDisplayAs3: The string that the user interface SHOULD display instead of the e-mail address in the Email3 field when users send mail to this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Fax1: Primary fax number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Fax2: Second fax number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Fax3: Third fax number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FaxDisplayAs1: The string that the user interface SHOULD display instead of the fax number in the Fax1 field when a user sends a fax to this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FaxDisplayAs2: The string that the user interface SHOULD display instead of the fax number in the Fax2 field when a user sends a fax to this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FaxDisplayAs3: The string that the user interface SHOULD display instead of the fax number in the Fax3 field when a user sends a fax to this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FileAs: The string that the user interface SHOULD display as the name of this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FirstName: The first name of the contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FirstNamePhonetic: Yomigana for the first name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FreeBusyURL: A URL to a location where clients can retrieve information about when the contact is busy.
[In Contact-Specific Schema][For information of FreeBusyURL]See PidLidFreeBusyLocation in [MS-OXOCNTC], section 2.2.1.10.10.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FTPSite: A URL to a File Transfer Protocol (FTP) site (1).
[In Contact-Specific Schema]FullName: The full name of the contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Gender: The contact's gender.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]If this field[Gender] is an integer type, clients SHOULD interpret it as a Gender.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]If this field[Gender] is a Choice type, the MAPPINGS element SHOULD be present<36>
[In Contact-Specific Schema][If Gender field is a Choice type]clients MUST use the <MAPPINGS> element to convert to and from the Gender type.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]See [MS-LISTSWS] on fields that are of the Choice type.
[In Contact-Specific Schema][If <MAPPINGS> element is present]Each <MAPPING> element within the <MAPPINGS> element holds a number and a string.

[In Contact-Specific Schema][The schema definition of CHOICES is:]<s:element name="CHOICES"> <s:sequence> <s:element name="CHOICE" type="string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </s:sequence> </s:element>
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CHOICES: Defines a list of valid values for the field that contains the CHOICE element.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]CHOICES.CHOICE: A valid string for this property.

[In Contact-Specific Schema][The schema definition of MAPPINGS is:]<s:element name="MAPPINGS"> <s:sequence> <s:element name="MAPPING" type="string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <s:complexType> <s:simpleContent> <s:extension base="string"> <s:attribute name="Value" type="integer" use="required" /> </s:extension> </s:simpleContent> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:element>

[In Contact-Specific Schema]MAPPINGS.MAPPING and MAPPINGS.Value: If a string in a CHOICE element exactly matches a string in a MAPPING element, the MAPPING.Value attribute associated with it can be used to represent the string.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]This allows protocol clients to go between protocol servers running different languages and have the protocol servers tell protocol clients how to translate.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Protocol clients can store the Gender as a string.
[In Contact-Specific Schema][Protocol clients]SHOULD store it[Gender] as an integer if the string[contained in Gender] matches a MAPPING value.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]GovernmentIDNumber: Any string that describes the contact's identification number with the government.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Hobbies: A string describing the contact's hobbies.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Home2Number: Second home phone number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomeAddress: Home address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomeAddressCity: Home city name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomeAddressCountry: Home country or region name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomeAddressPostalCode: Post office box number in the home address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomeAddressStateOrProvince: The name of the state in the home address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomeFaxNumber: Home fax number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomeFreeForm: Any string that describes the contact's home address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomePhone: Home phone number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]HomeZip: The zip code or postal code in the home address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]IMAddress: Instant messaging address or name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Initials: The initials of the contact's name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ISDNNumber: A phone number used for Internet services.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]JobTitle: The contact's job title.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Language: Any text that describes the contact's language.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]LastNamePhonetic: Yomigana for the last name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Location: Any string describing a location.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ManagersName: The name of the contact's manager.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]MiddleName: The contact's middle name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Mileage: Any user-entered text representing some mileage information associated with the contact for purposes of reimbursement.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]NameTitle: A title associated with a name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]This title comes before the name.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Use Suffix for titles that come after names
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Nickname: The contact's nickname.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OfficeLocation: Any string describing the location of the contact's office.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ol_Department: Any string describing the contact's work or business department.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OrganizationalIDNumber: Any string describing the contact's organizational identifier number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherAddressCity: A city name for the contact's general purpose address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherAddressCountry: A country or region name for the contact's general purpose address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherAddressPostalCode: A postal code for the contact's general purpose address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherAddressPObox: A post office box number for the contact's general purpose address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherAddressStateOrProvince: A state or province name for the contact's general purpose address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherAddressStreet: A street name for the contact's general purpose address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherFaxNumber: General purpose fax number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherFreeForm: Any text that describes the contact's general purpose address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]OtherNumber: Any phone number associated with the contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]PagerNumber: A pager number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]PersonalWebsite: The contact's personal Web site.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Photo: A URL to the contact's picture.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Pictures SHOULD be stored as some kind of image file.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]There is no guarantee that this URL points to safe data.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]The value of Photo SHOULD be a URL to one of the item's attachments, but can be any URL.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Protocol clients can use Photo to find the contact's picture, but AttachProps SHOULD be used instead.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]PrimaryNumber: The contact's primary phone number.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]PostAddrID: Any string describing a postal address identifier.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Profession: Any string describing a profession.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]RadioNumber: A phone number for a radio phone.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]ReferredBy: Any string describing who or what referred this contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]SpouseName: The name of the contact's spouse or domestic partner.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Suffix: A suffix or any other text.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]TelexNumber: The phone number of a telex printer.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]Title: Any string describing the contact's title.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]TTYTDDNumber: The phone number of a telephone device for the deaf (TDD).
[In Contact-Specific Schema]UserField1: This can be used for any text data about the contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]UserField2: This can be used for any text data about the contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]UserField3: This can be used for any text data about the contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]UserField4: This can be used for any text data about the contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WebPage: A URL to a Web page for the contact.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkAddress: The street address where the contact works.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkCity: The name of the city where the contact works.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkCountry: The name of the country or region where the contact works.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkFax: The fax number at the contact's workplace.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkFreeForm: Any string describing the location of the contact's workplace.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkPhone: The phone number of the contact's work phone.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkPObox: The post office box number in the contact's work address.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkState: The name of the state where the contact works.
[In Contact-Specific Schema]WorkZip: The zip code or postal code of the contact's workplace.

[In Discussion-Specific Schema]Title: The current title or subject of the discussion item.

[In Document-Specific Schema]FileDirRef: Protocol clients can parse the FileDirRef and RootFolder values to create a representation of the folders for the user.
[In Document-Specific Schema]The URL text that is between backslash (\) characters can be used as folder names.
[In Document-Specific Schema]The value of the RootFolder attribute listed in section 3.1.4.5.1.1 SHOULD appear at the beginning of the FileDirRef value.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R732.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Document-Specific Schema]FileSizeDisplay: The size of the file in bytes.
[In Document-Specific Schema]This[FileSizeDisplay] MUST be present and valid.
[In Document-Specific Schema]Protocol clients SHOULD add up the total size of all document items they intend to download and compare this to the MaxBulkDocumentSyncSize listed in section 3.1.4.7.1.1.
[In Document-Specific Schema]Protocol clients SHOULD NOT download the document files if the total size is greater than MaxBulkDocumentSyncSize.
[In Document-Specific Schema]Instead, protocol clients SHOULD only download the document items.
[In Document-Specific Schema]Protocol clients can indicate to users whether each document item's file has or has not been downloaded.
[In Document-Specific Schema]LinkCheckedOutTitle: The name of the person who currently has this file checked out.
[In Document-Specific Schema]LinkFilename: The file name of the document.
[In Document-Specific Schema]This[LinkFilename] MUST be present and valid.
[In Folder-Specific Schema]Folder items are items with the folder ContentTypeId listed in section 3.2.4.2.1.
[In Folder-Specific Schema]Folder items can appear in lists containing document and discussion items and use the same schema as the items they appear with.
[In Folder-Specific Schema]A folder item in a document list is covered in section 3.2.1.4.
[In Folder-Specific Schema]A folder item in list with discussion items is a root item as described in section 3.2.1.3.
[In Task-Specific Schema]The task schema specifies task items defined in the tasks (section 3.2.1.5) abstract data model.
[In Task-Specific Schema]All task properties can be empty or missing unless this section states otherwise.

[In Task-Specific Schema]ActualWork: Actual work time spent on the task expressed in number of minutes.
[In Task-Specific Schema]AssignedTo: The person to whom the task is currently assigned.
[In Task-Specific Schema]Body: Any user-entered text about the task.
[In Task-Specific Schema]This[Body] SHOULD be the primary place to enter text.
[In Task-Specific Schema]BillingInformation: Billing information for the task.
[In Task-Specific Schema]ContactLinkName: Names of people, businesses, or other names that serve as contacts.
[In Task-Specific Schema]This[ContactLinkName] is typically a semicolon delimited string, but can be any text.
[In Task-Specific Schema]DateComplete: The date that the task was finished.
[In Task-Specific Schema]If the task is not complete, then protocol clients SHOULD ignore this.
[In Task-Specific Schema]DueDate: The date that the task is due.
[In Task-Specific Schema]Editor: The last person who changed this item.
[In Task-Specific Schema]EmailBody: This text overrides the text in the Body property when the item's ContentTypeId indicates a workflow task. See section 3.2.4.2.1.
[In Task-Specific Schema]FormURN: This property SHOULD be ignored by protocol clients<38>.
[In Task-Specific Schema]FormURN: This property SHOULD be ignored by protocol servers.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R860.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Task-Specific Schema]FormURN: Reply SHOULD be the same whether a null or non-null value is set for this field.
[In Task-Specific Schema][FormURN]SHOULD NOT be present[on the client].
[In Task-Specific Schema]Protocol clients can set this[FormURN] to any text string.
[In Task-Specific Schema]LastUpdate: The date and time when the task was last updated.
[In Task-Specific Schema]Mileage: Any user entered text that contains mileage information associated with the task for purposes of reimbursement.
[In Task-Specific Schema]PercentComplete: A percentage describing how close the task is to being done.
[In Task-Specific Schema][For PercentComplete]0% means nothing is done.
[In Task-Specific Schema][For PercentComplete]100% means everything is done.
[In Task-Specific Schema]Priority: A choice between several strings that describe how important the task is.
[In Task-Specific Schema]These strings are provided by the protocol server as part of the schema.
[In Task-Specific Schema]See [MS-LISTSWS] on fields that are of the Choice type.
[In Task-Specific Schema]In addition to the CHOICES element, the protocol server SHOULD provide a MAPPINGS element.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OUTSPS_R77301.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Task-Specific Schema]Each MAPPINGS element holds a number and a string.

[In Task-Specific Schema][The schema definition of CHOICES is:]<s:element name="CHOICES"> <s:sequence> <s:element name="CHOICE" type="string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" /> </s:sequence> </s:element>
[In Task-Specific Schema]CHOICES: Defines a list of valid values for the field that contains the CHOICE element.
[In Task-Specific Schema]CHOICES.CHOICE: A valid string for this property.

[In Task-Specific Schema][The schema definiton of MAPPINGS is:]<s:complexType name="MAPPINGS"> <s:sequence> <s:element name="MAPPING" type="string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <s:complexType> <s:simpleContent> <s:extension base="string"> <s:attribute name="Value" type="integer" use="required" /> </s:extension> </s:simpleContent> </s:complexType> </s:element> </s:sequence> </s:complexType>

[In Task-Specific Schema]MAPPINGS.MAPPING and MAPPINGS.Value: If a string in a CHOICE element exactly matches a string in a MAPPING element, then the MAPPING.Value attribute associated with it can be used to represent the string.
[In Task-Specific Schema]This allows protocol clients to go between protocol servers running different languages and have the protocol servers tell protocol clients how to translate.
[In Task-Specific Schema]Role: Any user entered text about the role the task plays.
[In Task-Specific Schema]StartDate: The date that work on the task is supposed to begin.
[In Task-Specific Schema]Status: This is the status of the task.
[In Task-Specific Schema]This property[Status] works exactly the same way as the Priority task property also specified in this section (see section 3.2.4.2.8).
[In Task-Specific Schema]TaskCompanies: Any text describing companies that the task is for, companies doing the task, or any other companies, businesses, or people.
[In Task-Specific Schema]Title: The title of the task.
[In Task-Specific Schema]TotalWork: The total amount of work time spent on the task so far, in minutes.

[In Timer Events]TimeElapsedSinceLastSync: Protocol clients MUST NOT initiate the Lists Client Sync Protocol if this timer is less than the value of MinTimeBetweenSyncs, which is listed in section 3.1.4.7.1.1.
[In Timer Events]Protocol clients SHOULD NOT initiate the Lists Client Sync Protocol if this timer is less than RecommendedTimeBetweenSyncs, which is listed in section 3.1.4.7.1.1.
[In Timer Events]This timer[TimeElapsedSinceLastSync] is reset to 0 when the Lists Client Sync Protocol completes.
[In Other Local Events]Users can initiate the Lists Client Sync Protocol or cancel it at any time, except where timers prevent this.
[In Other Local Events]If the protocol is cancelled, then all remote operations and all processing of results SHOULD be aborted at the protocol client's earliest opportunity.

[In Lost, Interrupted, or Failed Connections]Protocol clients SHOULD either restart this protocol using an alternate URL (see section 3.2.4.1) or abort the protocol[if lost, interrupted, or failed connections happens].
[In Server or List Restoration]If a protocol server restores data from backups then protocol clients might not be able to determine the correct state of the items.
[In Server or List Restoration]Protocol clients SHOULD discard their local data because the protocol server might have been restored to undo changes that protocol clients still have.
[In Server or List Restoration]Protocol clients can keep a backup of changes that were not uploaded to the protocol server.
[In Server or List Restoration]A protocol server or list restoration event is indicated by Changes.Id.ChangeType="restore" and no data in the Changes.Id listed in section 3.1.4.7.1.1

[In Permission Changes]Protocol clients know permissions have changed by comparing GetListItemChangesSinceTokenResponse.GetListItemChangesSinceTokenResult.listitems.EffectivePermMask (see [MS-LISTSWS]) to the last value they received from that attribute.
[In Permission Changes]If the values differ then permissions changed.
[In Permission Changes]Clients SHOULD discard their change token and restart this protocol when permissions change.
[In Permission Changes]Any items not received upon completion of this protocol SHOULD be deleted from the protocol client.
[In Permission Changes]Protocol clients SHOULD do this because protocol servers will not give protocol clients information about items they do not have access to.
[In Permission Changes]If the protocol client does not do this, a permission change can result in items remaining on the protocol client after the protocol client loses access to them.

[In Corrupt or Invalid Data]If a protocol client uploads an item and the protocol server rejects the item data given in UpdateListItems (section 3.1.4.10), then the protocol client SHOULD NOT attempt to upload that item again.
[In Corrupt or Invalid Data]Protocol clients SHOULD keep a copy of the failed item.
[In Corrupt or Invalid Data]Protocol clients SHOULD discard the change token and restart this protocol to get the correct current state of the list.
[In Corrupt or Invalid Data]Protocol clients can use a WSDL operation from [MS-LISTSWS] to download only the failed item instead.
[In Restoring Items]Protocol clients can follow the server list restoration (section 3.2.6.2) logic when Changes.Id.ChangeType="restore" and an integer is given in Changes.Id
[In Restoring Items]This[Changes.Id.ChangeType="restore" and an integer is given in Changes.Id] indicates an item was restored from backups.
[In Restoring Items]Protocol clients can use a WSDL operation from [MS-LISTSWS] to download only the restored item.

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Unless otherwise specified, the term "MAY" implies that the product does not follow the prescription.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<1> Section 2.2.5.7: This type is available only in Outlook 2013 and SharePoint Foundation 2013.

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<2> Section 3.1.4: Office Outlook 2007 uses the GetListResult.List.ServerSettings.ServerVersion in GetListResponse (see section 3.1.4.5 and [MS-LISTSWS]) to determine whether Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 supports GetListItemChangesSinceToken.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior][<2> Section 3.1.4: ]A value of "12.0.0.4326" or greater indicates the server supports GetListItemChangesSinceToken.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Implementation does not support GetListItemChangesSinceToke. (<4> Section 3.1.4: Windows SharePoint Services 2.0 does not support GetListItemChangesSinceToken.)
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Implementation does support GetListItemChangesSinceToke.(Microsoft Office Outlook 2003 and Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 and above follow this behavior)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<5> Section 3.1.4.2: Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 uses AddDiscussionBoardItem to apply the same processing rules that incoming e-mail receives, which includes assigning one e-mail to be the root item described in section 3.2.1.3.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<6> Section 3.1.4.5.1.1: Office Outlook 2003 and Office Outlook 2007 ignore this attribute.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<7> Section 3.1.4.7: Office Outlook 2003 uses GetListItems because Office Outlook 2003 does not support GetListItemChangesSinceToken.

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]Implementation does sort items by the ID field, in ascending order. (<8> Section 3.1.4.7: In Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 and SharePoint Foundation 2010, if there is no "query" element in the request, the server will sort items by the ID field, in ascending order.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<9> Section 3.1.4.7: Office Outlook 2007 sets rowLimit to 100 by default.rowLimit can be configured to use a number between 15 and 1000. Office Outlook 2007 omits rowLimit when using this protocol to download appointments.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<10> Section 3.1.4.7: Office Outlook 2003 do not support the "v3" recurrence patterns listed here.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<10> Section 3.1.4.7: Windows SharePoint Services 2.0 do not support the "v3" recurrence patterns listed here.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<11> Section 3.1.4.8: The Translate header is a Microsoft extension to the HTTP specification used in conjunction with WebDAV functionality.

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Implementation does have zero or one total exceptions and deleted instances. (<12> Section 3.2.1.1.2: Windows SharePoint Services 2.0, Windows SharePoint Services 3.0, SharePoint Foundation 2010, and SharePoint Foundation 2013 allow this).
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix B: Product Behavior][<12> Section 3.2.1.1.2:] Office Outlook 2003, Office Outlook 2007, Outlook 2010, and Outlook 2013 do not allow this.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior][<13> Section 3.2.1.1.3:]Office Outlook 2003 and Office Outlook 2007 treat exception items that have no recurrence as single appointments (section 3.2.1.1.1).
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<14> Section 3.2.1.1.3: Office Outlook 2003 do not support restoring instances of a recurrence once they have become exceptions.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<14> Section 3.2.1.1.3: Office Outlook 2007 do not support restoring instances of a recurrence once they have become exceptions.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior][<14> Section 3.2.1.1.3:]Windows SharePoint Services 2.0 allow this[restoring instances of a recurrence once they have become exceptions].
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior][<14> Section 3.2.1.1.3:]Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 allow this.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<15> Section 3.2.1.1.4: Windows SharePoint Services 2.0 can be configured to display deleted instance items.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<15> Section 3.2.1.1.4: Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 can be configured to display deleted instance items.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<16> Section 3.2.1.1.4: Windows SharePoint Services 2.0 convert exception items to deleted instance items and remove some of the data on the items.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<16> Section 3.2.1.1.4: Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 convert exception items to deleted instance items and remove some of the data on the items.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior][<16> Section 3.2.1.1.4: ]Office Outlook 2007 deletes the exception item and uploads a deleted instance item to replace it.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<17> Section 3.2.4.1: Office Outlook 2003 ignores MinTimeBetweenSyncs.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior][<17> Section 3.2.4.1: ]Office Outlook 2007 can be configured to ignore MinTimeBetweenSyncs.

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<18> Section 3.2.4.2: Office Outlook 2003 reads only the following fields, ignores all other appointment-specific fields, and reads these only if they are in the server's current schema:Description,Duration,EndDate,EventDate,EventType,FooterInfo,fRecurrence,HeaderInfo,LinkTitle,Location,RecurrenceData,RecurrenceID,UID,XMLTZone

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<19> Section 3.2.4.2: Office Outlook 2003 reads only the following field, ignores all other contact-specific fields, and reads these only if they are in the server's current schema:Birthday,CellPhone,Comments,Company,CompanyPhonetic,Email,FileAs,FirstName,FirstNamePhonetic,HomeAddress,HomeCity,HomeCountry,HomePhone,HomeState,HomeZip,JobTitle,LastNamePhonetic,MiddleName,NameTitle,OfficeLocation,Suffix,Title,WebPage,Wedding,WorkAddress,WorkCity,WorkCountry,WorkFax,WorkPhone,WorkState,WorkZip
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<20> Section 3.2.4.2.1: Office Outlook 2003 reads only the following fields and ignores all other common properties:ID,Attachments
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<21> Section 3.2.4.2.1: Office Outlook 2007 will use ReplicationID only if it is a property bag field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<22> Section 3.2.4.2.1: Office Outlook 2007 will use vti_versionhistory only if it is a property bag field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<23> Section 3.2.4.2.1: Office Outlook 2003 ignores ContentTypeId. Office Outlook 2007 ignores ContentTypeId on calendar lists.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<24> Section 3.2.4.2.1: Office Outlook 2007 can remove old GUID-integer pairs if the version history becomes large.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<24> Section 3.2.4.2.1: Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 can remove old GUID-integer pairs if the version history becomes large.

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<25> Section 3.2.4.2.2: Office Outlook 2003 reads only the following fields, ignores all other appointment-specific fields, and reads these only if they are in the server's current schema: Description,Duration,EndDate,EventDate,EventType,FooterInfo,fRecurrence,HeaderInfo,LinkTitle,Location,RecurrenceData,RecurrenceID,UID,XMLTZone

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Implementation does have the fAllDayEvent field. (<26> Section 3.2.4.2.2: Windows SharePoint Services 2.0 does not have the fAllDayEvent field. Office Outlook 2003 ignores the fAllDayEvent field.)

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Implementation does default the value of AllDayEvent to 0 which means false if fAllDayEvent is empty or missing. (Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 and above follow this behavior.)

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<28> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2003 reads only the following fields, ignores all other contact-specific fields, and reads these only if they are in the server's current schema: Birthday,CellPhone,Comments,Company,CompanyPhonetic,Email,FileAs,FirstName,FirstNamePhonetic,HomeAddress,HomeCity,HomeCountry,HomePhone,HomeState,HomeZip,JobTitle,LastNamePhonetic,MiddleName,NameTitle,OfficeLocation,Suffix,Title,WebPage,Wedding,WorkAddress,WorkCity,WorkCountry,WorkFax,WorkPhone,WorkState,WorkZip
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<29> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2007 use Wedding instead of Anniversary for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<29> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2003 use Wedding instead of Anniversary for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<30> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2007 interprets this field as an integer Gender only.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior][<30> Section 3.2.4.2.4]Clients SHOULD interpret it as a choice type when the server includes CHOICE and MAPPING elements.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<31> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2003 use HomeCity instead of HomeAddressCity for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<31> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2007 use HomeCity instead of HomeAddressCity for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<32> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2003 use HomeCountry instead of HomeAddressCountry for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<32> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2007 use HomeCountry instead of HomeAddressCountry for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<33> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2003 use HomeZip instead of HomeAddressPostalCode for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<33> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2007 use HomeZip instead of HomeAddressPostalCode for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<34> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2003 use HomeState instead of HomeAddressStateOrProvince for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<34> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2007 use HomeState instead of HomeAddressStateOrProvince for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<35> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2003 use OfficeLocation instead of Office for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<35> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Office Outlook 2007 use OfficeLocation instead of Office for this field.
[In Appendix B: Product Behavior]<36> Section 3.2.4.2.4: Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 and Microsoft SharePoint Server 2010 do not include the MAPPINGS element for the Gender field.

[In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Implementation does set the default value of AssignedTo to User. (<37> Section 3.2.4.2.8: For Windows SharePoint Services 3.0 and SharePoint Foundation 2010, the default type is User.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Appendix B: Product Behavior] Implementation does set the default value of AssignedTo to UserMulti. (<37> Section 3.2.4.2.8: For SharePoint Foundation 2013, the default type is UserMulti.)
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: This requirement can be enabled/disabled in the deployment.ptfconfig file.
